meanings.definition: Relating to or involving large-scale evolutionary changes over long periods of time.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the macroevolutionary process of how dinosaurs evolved into birds.
meanings.sent2: The professor's research focused on macroevolutionary changes in plant species over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The macroevolutionary transformation of tiny fish into massive whales must have been quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The macroevolutionary shift from single-celled organisms to complex life forms is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the macroevolutionary concept helps us appreciate the gradual changes in species over time.

meanings.definition: The study of major evolutionary trends and patterns.
meanings.sent1: In her class, they delved deep into the world of macroevolutionary studies.
meanings.sent2: The book provided a comprehensive overview of macroevolutionary theories.
meanings.sent3: The macroevolutionary lecture was so fascinating that even the sleepy students perked up.
meanings.sent4: His research opened up new avenues in the field of macroevolutionary exploration.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit beautifully illustrated the concept of macroevolutionary changes.
